name: Holiday Inn Atlanta Capitol Conference Center

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text: From check in to check out we received excellent service. With just a smile and asking nicely we were upgraded to a King Suite-sitting area was the adjoining room. Like an apartment. We really enjoyed our stay. When traveling we always rent a car and much to our surprise they waived the parking fee we were there for a week. Celebrating my husband's 40 B-Day-we live in Philly, but my husband is from ATL and I gave him a surprise B-day party in ATL. The Holiday Inn's staff courtesy and professionalism definitely added to my husband's surprise celebration. THANK YOU HOLIDAY

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: We loved the proximity to Turner Field, walk across the street and down a block and your inside. The lobby is beautiful and the staff was very friendly and efficient. Our room was in tip top shape and furnished nicely. We were on the 7th floor and had a nice view. The bar has a full menu and a smaller bar menu after 11:00PM. Food was very good and the bartenders were fantastic. There is a shuttle to take you further downtown which makes getting around easy.

reviews.title: OK for the price
reviews.text: Stayed here during a conference in Atlanta. I booked this hotel through Priceline for $65 a night. The location is pretty bad--like the other reviewer said. Nothing but parking lots for Turner Field down the street. I actually walked all the way to the Centennial Park from the hotel and it took 40 minutes (and through some unsavory streets). The shuttle is the saving grace to their bad location. The shuttle driver was courteous and willing to drive to and pick you up from any reasonable location downtown between 7:30 am and 10pm, including where the conference was held. The rooms are pretty standard. There was no mini-fridge in the room. The maid service forgot to make the rooms one night--which was no big deal, since there were plenty of towels left on the rack. Overall: a bad location made up by a free shuttle service. Good price through Priceline. I will probably stay a bit closer to Midtown area next time I'm in Atlanta. The downtown are is pretty dead after dark. Buckhead is a bit far and you definitely need a car to get around there.

reviews.title: Average at best
reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean, and looks better on the inside than on the outside. The hotel is showing some signs of aging. There is a large pool outside. Our room was clean upon arrival and cleaned daily to our satisfaction.

reviews.title: Shuttle service excellent; good location for downtown tours
reviews.text: Problems-

A comfortable hotel with good-sized rooms, but not much character. The room was clean and the complimentary wi-fi was great. The hotel is about a mile away from town with nothing but carparking for Turner Field & a couple of govt facilities around it. The hotel shuttle was very functional and the delays they quoted when I called for a ride back to the hotel were surprisingly accurate. Given the location, the shuttle is important.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in poor location

reviews.text: I wish I had read the reviews before I booked this hotel. The MARTA is not within walking distance, at least not in my definition of walking distance. It does seem that questionable neighborhoods are close by. If I had not been with my husband when I got off the MARTA at 8:15 p.m., I would have been even more concerned about walking back to the hotel. We left after 1 night because of the location. Underground Atlanta, Georgia Dome, Centenial Park - all too far to walk. No convenient restaurants, convenience stores - it seems like the only thing in the area other than Turner Field.
reviews.title: Not a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, it seemed OK. Breakfast was the only meal we ate, and it was fine but overpriced.
reviews.title: Only worth a 2 star rating

likes.liked: — 4 elevators made the wait for them very short
likes.disliked: — Mold, hidden parking charges, horrible location, poor restraunt, cheap feel to the hotel

reviews.text: Pay more and stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: Nice Staff, bad location

reviews.text: The Bad:
reviews.title: Good Value, But Avoid Restaurant!
Stayed here for DragonCon- overall not bad, but I would have liked to be closer
reviews.text: Got a great deal on this hotel through priceline. I was bummed out to see that it was just south of the Highway next to Turner field when I bid in the downtown area.

reviews.title: Could have done better!
reviews.text: It is just a little removed and there is really nothing there. The immediate area is not bad, however if you are walking to downtown you will cross some neighborhoods that I would not walk though at night. I am a caucasian fellow, and to walk though these poor African American neighborhoods at night with lots of homeless people is like waving a flag to be mugged. That said, this hotel has a shuttle that will bring you anywhere within a 3 mile radius for free, so that was never a problem getting to an from our convention at the Hyatt.

reviews.title: No problems here,
reviews.text: There is also a cab stand at the hotel, so if you need a cab..it is always there. It cost $12 anywhere downtown. The hotel also has an outdoor pool and is very clean. Basic hotel rooms. Restaurant is ok..they have a buffett. They also have a bar and workout room on the premisis.

reviews.title: Great for Braves Games
reviews.text: If you are seeing a game at Turner Field..this is the perfect place. If you are traveling downtown each day maybe not so much. The one thing I can brag about is that I payed $60 a night for this place through priceline, when I would have paid $200 a night downtown for my dates..so even with being a little removed and having to shuttle or cab it back and forth... I saved big bucks! I wouldn't have been so pleased if I payed full price unless I was going to the Braves.

reviews.title: Fine for Braves games
reviews.text: One last thing. To get here from the Airport, take the MARTA to 5 Points station and have the hotel pick you up with the Shuttle. Total cost: 1.50.

reviews.title: Quality Hotel, Terrible "Downtown" Location
reviews.text: I was coming to Atlanta to attend a conference and didn't want to pay $200+/night for the conference hotels for 4 nights. So I went to Hotwire and requested a downtown hotel and got this hotel for about $80/night. Great savings obviously. But the "downtown" title that Holiday Inn uses and Hotwire uses are clearly misnomers as others have pointed out. This hotel is not within walking distance of downtown and the cultural, tourist, restaurants, and entertainment sites. In fact take away Turner Field and the surrounding parking lots and this hotel would be in a very depressed neighborhood that clearly is NOT safe come night time. I attended a Braves game during my stay so I appreciated the location for at least one night. But quite literally there is nothing within walking distance (no shopping-drugstore for example, no restaurants, no nothing).

reviews.title: Updated and well appointed!
reviews.text: As a result of the location, I was isolated the first night and chose to go down to the restaurant for takeout (the fees for room services seemed higher than other places-21% plus a $2.50 delivery charge). They had a buffet that was about $20 but when I saw it and how sparse the selections were (salad bar had about 5-7 items besides dressings), I selected a $10 1/2 sandwich and soup combo. Decent, not spectacular food. Add on $2 for a soda in the gift shop and it turned out to be a pricey dinner for a small meal.

reviews.title: Seen better days !
reviews.text: From a "business" standpoint, the free wireless internet was appealing to me and I used it frequently, I still can't understand why some high-end hotels charge for it, always feels like they nickle and dime you when they do that. The business center was sufficient as I needed to print out a few documents. Alas I needed a plain white envelope and the front desk didn't have any even though they said they had extra office supplies. And if the front desk or gift shop doesn't have it, that means you are going to have to travel to downtown or the burbs to find what you need. Same thing with clothing, I needed a pair of dress socks and the gift shop couldn't provide, yet neither could downtown Atlanta. As a Chicagoan, I am used to finding multiple choices within a few blocks for clothing, but I digress.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: The shuttle they had was fairly decent. You can ignore their styrofoam tip cup but if you want to be picked up later by the shuttle driver (they give you a sheet to call them for a pickup downtown), it probably would be wise to throw in a few bucks.

reviews.title: You can do better!!!
reviews.text: I usually work out, but didn't have a chance to check out the workout facility, though I heard one existed. There's also an outdoor pool that seemed okay.

aka: Holiday Inn Atlanta Capitol Hotel Atlanta
description: Discover all that beautiful downtown Atlanta has to offer at the convenient and comfortable Holiday Inn Atlanta Capitol Conference Center. With our location only 10 minutes from the Hartsfield Jackson International Airport (ATL), you will spend more time doing what you came to Atlanta to do and less time in traffic. We are a beautiful AAA Diamond hotel located at the crossroads of all major interstates (I-20 and I-75/85).
